content:
Check:
  any:
    - all:
        - name: --DUR
          operator: non_empty
        - name: --DUR
          operator: not_matches_regex
          value: ^-?P([0-9]+Y)?([0-9]+M)?([0-9]+D)?(T([0-9]+H)?([0-9]+M)?([0-9]+(\.?[0-9]+)?S)?)?$
        - name: --DUR
          operator: not_matches_regex
          value: ^-?P([0-9]+W)$
    - all:
        - name: --EVLINT
          operator: non_empty
        - name: --EVLINT
          operator: not_matches_regex
          value: ^-?P([0-9]+Y)?([0-9]+M)?([0-9]+D)?(T([0-9]+H)?([0-9]+M)?([0-9]+(\.?[0-9]+)?S)?)?$
        - name: --EVLINT
          operator: not_matches_regex
          value: ^-?P([0-9]+W)$
    - all:
        - name: --ELTM
          operator: non_empty
        - name: --ELTM
          operator: not_matches_regex
          value: ^-?P([0-9]+Y)?([0-9]+M)?([0-9]+D)?(T([0-9]+H)?([0-9]+M)?([0-9]+(\.?[0-9]+)?S)?)?$
        - name: --ELTM
          operator: not_matches_regex
          value: ^-?P([0-9]+W)$
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.59
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: --EVLINT, --ELTM, --DUR must be in ISO 8601 duration format, including
  the additional format that allows the representation of  "negative" intervals of
  time.
Outcome:
  Message: --DUR, --EVLINT or --ELTM is not in ISO 8601 Duration format
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
    - --ELTM
    - --EVLINT
    - --DUR
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Term
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '59'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: A fixed offset from the date provided by the variable
                  referenced in TDANCVAR. This is used when the timing of planned
                  cycles does not start on the exact day referen--EVLINT, --ELTM,
                  --DUR must be in ISO 8601 duration format, including the additional
                  format that allows the representation of  "negative" intervals of
                  time
                Document: IG v3.1
                Item: Specification
                Section: 7.3.2
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - INTERVENTIONS
      - FINDINGS
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL
